titlestmt.subtitle: An Inventory of Her Papers, 1952-1998 and undated, at the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library
titlestmt.author: Abel Ramirez

profiledesc.creation: Text converted and initial EAD tagging provided by Apex Data Services, February 2001.

change.item: urn:taro:ttu.sw.00058 converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (20030505).

titlepage.titleproper: Inventory for the Jeanne Williams Papers, 1952-1998 and undated
titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: The collection consists of correspondence and manuscripts pertaining to Jeanne Williams' literary career in juvenile and historical fiction.

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Jeanne Williams is an award-winning author of juvenile fiction, Gothic novels, historical romances, and historical novels. Born Dorothy Jean Kreie on April 10, 1930, she married Gene F. Williams at age 18 and used his name professionally. An avid reader and writer, she began to send out manuscripts in 1949 and was first published in 1952. Her career quickly gathered steam and she has since published over 27 books and several articles under various names. She specialized in novels based on historical fact, usually told from a feminine point of view. In 1960, Williams became a member of the Western Writers of America and served as president from 1974-1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of correspondence, literary productions (manuscripts), printed materials, and scrapbook material pertaining to Jeanne Williams' literary career writing historical western novels. The bulk of the collection is correspondence and manuscripts

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The materials are organized by the following series:

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jeanne Williams Papers, 1952-1998 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

bibliography.head: Additional Sources
bibliography.bibref: Alter, Judy. Jeanne Williams. Boise, Idaho: Boise State University, 1991.
